chapter.title: Preparing and Registering a Client
chapter.para: Registering clients with SUSE Manager is done with a bootstrap script that deploys all necessary information to the clients. The bootstrap script contains several parameters which define which channel a client system will have access to. Two of these parameters are:

The first parameter (Activation Keys) should be created from the web-GUI. These keys should be created and assigned to a previously added software channel. These keys act as identifiers for specific channels, and all client systems associated with a channel key will receive updates from the channel its key is associated with. By design a client may only be connected to one base channel through its activation or GPG key. This quick-start guide does not cover GPG key usage. For more information on using GPG Keys with Bootstrap see: Using Bootstrap with GPG Keys: Reference GuideAdd this link! For a list of client operating systems supported by SUSE Manager, refer to Section 3.1.2, “Supported Client Systems”.
